ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The Message and Attachment Object Protocol assumes the client has previously logged on to the server and has acquired a handle to the Folder object upon which it needs to operate.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] For more information on Folder objects, see [MS-OXCFOLD].
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] For more information on folder storage and organization, see [MS-OXCSTOR].
[In Vendor-Extensible Fields] A third-party application can create its own set of named properties on a Message object as described in [MS-OXCPRPT].

[In Vendor-Extensible Fields] A third-party application can also extend the Message and Attachment Object Protocol to implement its own object type by changing the PidTagMessageClass property (section 2.2.1.3).
[In Vendor-Extensible Fields] For a simple example that extends this protocol to implement an electronic representation of a "Sticky Note", see [MS-OXONOTE].

[In Transport] The ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers specified by this protocol [MS-OXCMSG] are sent to and respectively are received from the server using the underlying remote operations transport as specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In Message Syntax] Message objects can be created and modified by clients and servers.
[In Message Syntax] Except where noted, this section defines constraints to which both clients and servers adhere when operating on Message objects.
[In Message Syntax] Clients operate on Message objects using the ROPs as specified in section 2.2.3, and the Property and Stream Object Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.
[In Message Syntax] Unless otherwise specified, all property constraints specified in [MS-OXPROPS] apply to Message objects.
[In Message Syntax] A Message object can also contain other properties defined in [MS-OXPROPS], but these properties have no impact on this protocol [MS-OXCMSG].
[In Message Syntax] When a property is referred to as "read-only for the client", the server can return Success but not persist any changes to read-only properties<1>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R1724,MS-OXCMSG_R15,MS-OXCMSG_R1078,MS-OXCMSG_R231.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Syntax] Read-only properties that could not be saved are enumerated in the PropertyProblems field of the RopSetProperties ROP response, as specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6.2.

[In General Properties] The following properties [PidTagAccess, PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagChangeKey, PidTagCreationTime, PidTagLastModificationTime, PidTagLastModifierName, PidTagObjectType, PidTagRecordKey and PidTagSearchKey] exist on all Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagAccess exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagAccessLevel exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagChangeKey exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagCreationTime exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagLastModificationTime exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagLastModifierName exists on the Message objects.
[In General Properties] The Property PidTagObjectType<2> exists on the Message objects.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R3002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In General Properties] The Property PidTagRecordKey<3> exists on the Message objects.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R3004.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In General Properties] The Property PidTagSearchKey exists on the Message objects.

[In General Properties] These properties are read-only for the client: PidTagAccess, PidTagChangeKey, PidTagCreationTime, PidTagLastModificationTime, PidTagLastModifierName, PidTagObjectType, PidTagRecordKey and PidTagSearchKey.

[In General Properties] For specifications of the properties listed here see [MS-OXCPRPT]. PidTagAccess ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.1), PidTagAccessLevel ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.2), PidTagChangeKey ([MS-OXCFXICS] section 2.2.1.2.7), PidTagCreationTime (section 2.2.2.3), PidTagLastModificationTime (section 2.2.2.2), PidTagLastModifierName ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.5), PidTagObjectType ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.7), PidTagRecordKey ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.8), PidTagSearchKey ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.9).
[In PidTagHasAttachments Property] The PidTagHasAttachments property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.717) indicates whether the Message object contains at least one attachment.
[In PidTagHasAttachments Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagHasAttachments Property] This property [PidTagHasAttachments] is read-only for the client.
[In PidTagHasAttachments Property] The server computes this property [PidTagHasAttachments] from the mfHasAttach flag of the PidTagMessageFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.792).
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] The PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.788) denotes the specific type of the Message object.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] It determines the set of properties defined for the message, the kind of information the message conveys, and how to handle the message.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] All characters in this property [PidTagMessageClass] MUST be from the ASCII characters 0x20 through 0x7F.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] It [PtypString] MUST NOT end with a period (ASCII character 0x2E).
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Its length [PtypString] MUST be greater than zero and less than 256 characters.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Furthermore, its [PtypString] length SHOULD be fewer than 128 characters because some operations require extending the value of the PidTagMessageClass property.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R496.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagMessageClass Property] Any equality or matching operations performed against the value of this property [PidTagMessageClass] MUST be case-insensitive.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] The value of this property [PidTagMessageClass] is interpreted in groups of characters separated by periods (".").
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] Each group specifies a type of object.
[In PidTagMessageClass Property] A message class of "IPM.Note" denotes a standard Message object, and a message class of "Remote.IPM.Note" indicates a header message object.
[In PidTagMessageCodepage Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned.
[In PidTagMessageCodepage Property] The PidTagMessageCodepage property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.789) specifies the code page used to encode the non-Unicode string properties on this Message object.
[In PidTagMessageCodepage Property] The Folder object code page is used if this property [PidTagMessageCodepage] is set to 0x0000.
[In PidTagMessageLocaleId Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned.
[In PidTagMessageLocaleId Property] Contains the language code identifier (LCID) of the end-user who created this message.
[In PidTagMessageLocaleId Property] About the PidTagMessageLocaleId for more details see [MS-LCID].
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] The PidTagMessageFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.792) specifies the status of the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R510, MS-OXCMSG_R512, MS-OXCMSG_R515, MS-OXCMSG_R519, MS-OXCMSG_R520, MS-OXCMSG_R522, MS-OXCMSG_R525, MS-OXCMSG_R527, MS-OXCMSG_R529, MS-OXCMSG_R531.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagMessageFlags Property] Set to zero or to a bitwise OR of one or more of the values [0x00000001, 0x00000008, 0x00000080, 0x00000002, 0x00000004, 0x00000010, 0x00000020, 0x00000040, 0x00000100, 0x00000200, 0x00000400, 0x00002000 and 0x00008000] from the following tables [two tables in section 2.2.1.6].

[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] After the first successful call to the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3), as described in section 2.2.3.3, these flags [mfRead, mfUnsent, mfResend] are read-only for the client.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfRead (0x00000001)] The message is marked as having been read.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfUnsent (0x00000008)] The message is still being composed and is treated as a Draft Message object.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfUnsent (0x00000008)] This bit is cleared by the server when responding to the RopSubmitMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.7.1) with a success code.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfResend (0x00000080)] The message includes a request for a resend operation with a non-delivery report.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfResend (0x00000080)] For more details, see [MS-OXOMSG] section 3.2.4.5.

[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] These flags are always read-only for the client [mfUnmodified, mfSubmitted, mfHasAttach, mfFromMe, mfFAI, mfNotifyRead, mfNotifyUnread, mfEverRead, mfInternet, mfUntrusted].
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfUnmodified (0x00000002)] The message has not been modified since it was first saved (if unsent) or it was delivered (if sent).
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfSubmitted (0x00000004)] The message is marked for sending as a result of a call to the RopSubmitMessage ROP.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfHasAttach (0x00000010)] The message has at least one attachment.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfHasAttach (0x00000010)] This flag corresponds to the message's PidTagHasAttachments property (section 2.2.1.2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R16.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfFromMe (0x00000020)] The user receiving the message was also the user who sent the message.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfFAI (0x00000040)] The message is an FAI message.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfNotifyRead (0x00000100)] The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient (1) first reads it.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfNotifyUnread (0x00000200)] The user who sent the message has requested notification when a recipient (1) deletes it before reading or the Message object expires.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfEverRead (0x00000400)] The message has been read at least once.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfEverRead (0x00000400)] This flag is set by the server whenever the mfRead flag is set.<4>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R3006.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfEverRead (0x00000400)] This flag is cleared by the server whenever the mfRead flag is cleared.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfEverRead (0x00000400)] Clients SHOULD ignore this flag.

[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfInternet (0x00002000)] The incoming message arrived over the Internet and originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfUntrusted (0x00008000)] The incoming message arrived over an external link other than X.400 or the Internet.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] [mfUntrusted (0x00008000)] It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway does not consider trusted.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] The PidTagMessageFlags property is also modified using the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.11), as described in section 2.2.3.11.
[In PidTagMessageFlags Property] The pidTagMessageFlages property is modified using the RopSetReadFlags ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10), as described in section 2.2.3.10.
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned.
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] Contains the size in bytes consumed by the Message object on the server.
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] This property [PidTagMessageSize] is read-only for the client.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] Specifies the status of a message in a contents table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R542, MS-OXCMSG_R544, MS-OXCMSG_R547.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagMessageStatus Property] Contains a bitwise OR of zero or more of the following values [0x00001000, 0x00000800 and 0x00002000].
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [The value of flag msRemoteDownload is] 0x00001000.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [msRemoteDownload (0x00001000)] The message has been marked for downloading from the remote message store to the local client.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [The value of flag msInConflict is] 0x00000800.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [msInConflict (0x00000800)] This is a conflict resolve message as specified in [MS-OXCFXICS] section 3.1.5.6.2.1.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [msInConflict (0x00000800)] This is a read-only value for the client.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [The value of flag msRemoteDelete is] 0x00002000.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] [msRemoteDelete (0x00002000)] The message has been marked for deletion at the remote message store without downloading to the local client.
[In PidTagMessageStatus Property] More details about setting and obtaining the value of this property [PidTagMessageStatus] are specified in section 3.1.5.7 and section 3.1.5.8.
[In PidTagSubjectPrefix Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagSubjectPrefix Property] The PidTagSubjectPrefix property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1035) contains the prefix for the subject of the message.
[In PidTagSubjectPrefix Property] This property [PidTagSubjectPrefix] is set by the client but can be an empty string if there is no subject.
[In PidTagSubjectPrefix Property] The sum of the lengths of the PidTagNormalizedSubject property (section 2.2.1.10) and the PidTagSubjectPrefix property MUST be less than 254 characters.
[In PidTagSubjectPrefix Property] More details about the processing of this property are specified in section 3.1.5.13.
[In PidTagNormalizedSubject Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagNormalizedSubject Property] The PidTagNormalizedSubject property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.813) contains the normalized subject of the message, as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] section 2.2.3.2.6.1.
[In PidTagNormalizedSubject Property] This property [PidTagNormalizedSubject] is set by the client but can be an empty string if there is no subject.
[In PidTagNormalizedSubject Property] The sum of the lengths of the PidTagNormalizedSubject property and the PidTagSubjectPrefix property (section 2.2.1.9) MUST be less than 254 characters.
[In PidTagNormalizedSubject Property] More details about obtaining the value of this property are specified in section 3.1.5.13.
[In PidTagImportance Property]Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagImportance Property] The PidTagImportance property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.739) indicates the level of importance assigned by the end user to the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R72, MS-OXCMSG_R73, MS-OXCMSG_R74.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagImportance Property] This property [PidTagImportance] MUST be set to one of the following values [0x00000000, 0x00000001 and 0x00000002].
[In PidTagImportance Property] [The value 0x00000000 indicates the level of importance assigned by the end user to the Message object is] Low importance.
[In PidTagImportance Property] [The value 0x00000001 indicates the level of importance assigned by the end user to the Message object is] Normal importance.
[In PidTagImportance Property] [The value 0x00000002 indicates the level of importance assigned by the end user to the Message object is] High importance.
[In PidTagPriority Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagPriority Property] The PidTagPriority property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.872) indicates the client's request for the priority at which the message is to be sent by the messaging system.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R78, MS-OXCMSG_R79, MS-OXCMSG_R80.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagPriority Property] This property [PidTagPriority] is set to one of the following values [0x00000001, 0x00000000, 0xFFFFFFFF].
[In PidTagPriority Property] [The value 0x00000001 indicates the client's request for the priority is] Urgent.
[In PidTagPriority Property] [The value 0x00000000 indicates the client's request for the priority is] Normal.
[In PidTagPriority Property] [The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates the client's request for the priority is] Not urgent.
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] The PidTagSensitivity property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1011) indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R84, MS-OXCMSG_R86, MS-OXCMSG_R87, MS-OXCMSG_R88.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagSensitivity Property] The value of this property [PidTagSensitivity] is one of the following [0x00000000, 0x00000001, 0x00000002 and 0x00000003].
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] [The value 0x00000000 indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object is] Normal.
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] [The value 0x00000001 indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object is] Personal.
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] [The value 0x00000002 indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object is] Private.
[In PidTagSensitivity Property] [The value 0x00000003 indicates the sender's assessment of the sensitivity of the Message object is] Confidential.
[In PidLidSmartNoAttach Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidSmartNoAttach Property] The PidLidSmartNoAttach property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.302) is set to TRUE (0x01) if the Message object has no attachments that are visible to the end user.
[In PidLidSmartNoAttach Property] If this property is unset, a default value of FALSE (0x00) is used.
[In PidLidPrivate Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidLidPrivate Property] The PidLidPrivate property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.212) is set to TRUE (0x01) if the end user wants this Message object to be hidden from other users who have access to the Message object.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidLidSideEffects Property] The PidLidSideEffects property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.300) controls how a Message object is handled by the client in relation to certain user interface actions by the user, such as deleting a message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2008, MS-OXCMSG_R2009, MS-OXCMSG_R2010, MS-OXCMSG_R2011, MS-OXCMSG_R2012, MS-OXCMSG_R2013, MS-OXCMSG_R2014, MS-OXCMSG_R2015, MS-OXCMSG_R2016, MS-OXCMSG_R2018, MS-OXCMSG_R2018.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidLidSideEffects Property] This property [PidLidSideEffects] is set to a bitwise OR of zero or more of the following flags [seOpenToDelete, seNoFrame, seCoerceToInbox, seOpenToCopy, seOpenToMove, seOpenForCtxMenu, seCannotUndoDelete, seCannotUndoCopy, seCannotUndoMove, seHasScript and seOpenToPermDelete].
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seOpenToDelete is] 0x00000001.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seOpenToDelete (0x00000001)] The client opens the Message object when deleting.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seNoFrame is] 0x00000008.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seNoFrame (0x00000008)] No UI is associated with the Message object.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seCoerceToInbox is] 0x00000010.

[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCoerceToInbox (0x00000010)] The client moves the Message object to the Inbox folder when moving or copying to a Folder object with the PidTagContainerClass property ([MS-OXOCAL] section 2.2.11.1) set to "IPF.Note".
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCoerceToInbox (0x00000010)] For more details about the PidTagContainerClass property, see [MS-OXOSFLD] section 2.2.8.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seOpenToCopy is] 0x00000020.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seOpenToCopy (0x00000020)] The client opens the Message object when copying to another folder.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seOpenToMove is] 0x00000040.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seOpenToMove (0x00000040)] The client opens the Message object when moving to another folder.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seOpenForCtxMenu is] 0x00000100.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seOpenForCtxMenu (0x00000100)] The client opens the Message object when displaying context-sensitive commands, such as a context menu, to the end user.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seCannotUndoDelete is] 0x00000400.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoDelete (0x00000400)] The client cannot undo a delete operation.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoDelete (0x00000400)] This flag MUST NOT be set unless the seOpenToDelete flag is set.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seCannotUndoCopy is] 0x00000800.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoCopy (0x00000800)] The client cannot undo a copy operation.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoCopy (0x00000800)] This flag MUST NOT be set unless the seOpenToCopy flag is set.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seCannotUndoMove is] 0x00001000.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoMove (0x00001000)] The client cannot undo a move operation.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seCannotUndoMove (0x00001000)] This flag MUST NOT be set unless the seOpenToMove flag is set.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seHasScript is] 0x00002000.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seHasScript (0x00002000)] The Message object contains end-user script.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [The value of flag seOpenToPermDelete is] 0x00004000.
[In PidLidSideEffects Property] [seOpenToPermDelete (0x00004000)] The client opens the Message object to permanently delete it.
[In PidNameKeywords Property] Type: PtypMultipleString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidNameKeywords Property] The PidNameKeywords property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.451) contains keywords or categories (3) for the Message object.
[In PidNameKeywords Property] The length of each string within the multivalue string is less than 256 characters.
[In PidLidCommonStart Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidCommonStart Property] The PidLidCommonStart property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.64) indicates the start time for the Message object.
[In PidLidCommonStart Property] The value of this property [PidLidCommonStart] is less than or equal to the value of the PidLidCommonEnd property (section 2.2.1.19).
[In PidLidCommonStart Property] This time [the start time] is interpreted as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
[In PidLidCommonEnd Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidCommonEnd Property] The PidLidCommonEnd property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.63) indicates the end time for the Message object.
[In PidLidCommonEnd Property] The value of this property [PidLidCommonEnd Property] MUST be greater than or equal to the value of the PidLidCommonStart property (section 2.2.1.18).
[In PidLidCommonEnd Property] This time [the end time] is interpreted as UTC.
[In PidTagAutoForwarded Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAutoForwarded Property] The PidTagAutoForwarded property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.614) indicates that this message has been automatically generated or automatically forwarded.
[In PidTagAutoForwarded Property] If this property [PidTagAutoForwarded] is unset, a default value of 0x00 is assumed.
[In PidTagAutoForwardComment Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAutoForwardComment Property] The PidTagAutoForwardComment property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.613) contains a comment added by the autoforwarding agent.
[In PidLidCategories Property] Type: PtypMultipleString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidCategories Property] The PidLidCategories property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.50) contains the array of text labels assigned to this Message object.
[In PidLidClassification] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidClassification] The PidLidClassification property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.53) contains a list of the classification categories (3) to which this Message object has been assigned.
[In PidLidClassificationDescription Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidLidClassificationDescription Property] The PidLidClassificationDescription property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.54) contains a human-readable summary of each of the classification categories (3) included in the PidLidClassification property (section 2.2.1.23).
[In PidLidClassified Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidClassified Property] The PidLidClassified property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.57) indicates whether the contents of a message are regarded as classified information.
[In PidTagInternetReferences Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagInternetReferences Property] The PidTagInternetReferences property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.750) contains a list of message IDs (MIDs), as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2, that specify the messages to which this reply is related.
[In PidTagInternetReferences Property] The format of this property [MID] is specified in [RFC2822].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCDATA_R2180,MS-OXCDATA_R2181 and MS-OXCDATA_R2182.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidLidInfoPathFormName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidInfoPathFormName Property] The PidLidInfoPathFormName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.150) contains the name of the form associated with this message, if one exists.

[In PidLidInfoPathFormName Property] The relationship between this property [PidLidInfoPathFormName] and the Content-Class MIME header (2) is specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] sections 2.1.3.2.2 and 2.2.3.2.15.
[In PidTagMimeSkeleton Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagMimeSkeleton Property] The PidTagMimeSkeleton property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.804) contains all the top level MIME message headers (2), all MIME message body part headers (2), and body part content that is not already converted to Message object properties, including attachments.
[In PidTagMimeSkeleton Property] The use of the PidTagMimeSkeleton property for converting between MIME messages and Message object format is specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] section 2.4.3.1.
[In PidTagTnefCorrelationKey Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagTnefCorrelationKey Property] The PidTagTnefCorrelationKey property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1048) contains a value that correlates a Transport Neutral Encapsulation Format (TNEF) attachment with a message.
[In PidTagTnefCorrelationKey Property] This property [PidTagTnefCorrelationKey] determines whether or not an inbound TNEF file belongs to the message it is attached to.
[In PidTagTnefCorrelationKey Property] It [PidTagTnefCorrelationKey] is used primarily by transport providers and gateways.
[In PidTagAddressBookDisplayNamePrintable Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAddressBookDisplayNamePrintable Property] The PidTagAddressBookDisplayNamePrintable property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.514) contains the printable string version of the display name.
[In PidTagCreatorEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagCreatorEntryId Property] The PidTagCreatorEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.656) specifies the original author of the message according to their address book EntryID.
[In PidTagCreatorEntryId Property] The format of an address book EntryID data type is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.5.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCDATA_R2319, MS-OXCDATA_R2753, MS-OXCDATA_R2320, MS-OXCDATA_R2321, MS-OXCDATA_R2323.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagLastModifierEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagLastModifierEntryId Property] The PidTagLastModifierEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.766) specifies the last user to modify the contents of the message according to their address book EntryID.
[In PidTagLastModifierEntryId Property] The format of an address book EntryID data type is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.5.2.
[In PidLidAgingDontAgeMe Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidAgingDontAgeMe Property] The PidLidAgingDontAgeMe property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.4) specifies whether the message is to be automatically archived.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R1654, MS-OXCMSG_R1655.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidLidAgingDontAgeMe Property] This property [PidLidAgingDontAgeMe] is set to "TRUE" if the message will not be automatically archived.
[In PidLidAgingDontAgeMe Property] otherwise [the message will be automatically archived], [this property is set to] "FALSE".
[In PidLidCurrentVersion Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidCurrentVersion Property] The PidLidCurrentVersion property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.89) specifies the build number of the client application that sent the message.
[In PidLidCurrentVersionName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidCurrentVersionName Property] The PidLidCurrentVersionName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.90) specifies the name of the client application that sent the message.
[In PidTagAlternateRecipientAllowed Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAlternateRecipientAllowed Property] The PidTagAlternateRecipientAllowed property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.577) specifies whether the sender permits the message to be autoforwarded.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1797.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAlternateRecipientAllowed Property] This property [PidTagAlternateRecipientAllowed] is set to "TRUE" if autoforwarding is allowed.
[In PidTagResponsibility Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagResponsibility Property] The PidTagResponsibility property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.932) specifies whether another mail agent has ensured that the message will be delivered.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R1198, MS-OXCMSG_R1199.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagResponsibility Property] This property [PidTagResponsibility] is set to "TRUE" if another agent has accepted responsibility.
[In PidTagResponsibility Property] otherwise [another agent hasn't accepted responsibility], [property PidTagResponsibility is set to] "FALSE".
[In PidTagRowid Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRowid Property] The PidTagRowid property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.940) contains a unique identifier for a recipient (2) in the message's recipient table.
[In PidTagRowid Property] This is a temporary identifier that is valid only for the life of the Table object.
[In PidTagHasNamedProperties Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagHasNamedProperties Property] The PidTagHasNamedProperties property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.719) specifies whether this Message object supports named properties.
[In PidTagHasNamedProperties Property] The PidTagHasNamedProperties property is set to "TRUE" if this Message object supports named properties.
[In PidTagHasNamedProperties Property] The PidTagHasNamedProperties property is set to "FALSE" if this Message object doesn't support named properties.
[In PidTagRecipientOrder Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRecipientOrder Property] The PidTagRecipientOrder property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.903) specifies the location of the current recipient (2) in the recipient table.
[In PidNameContentBase Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidNameContentBase Property] The PidNameContentBase property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.412) specifies the value of the Content-Base header (2), which defines the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for resolving relative URLs contained within the message body.
[In PidNameAcceptLanguage Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidNameAcceptLanguage Property] The PidNameAcceptLanguage property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.367) contains the value of the Accept-Language header (2), which defines the natural languages in which the sender prefers to receive a response.
[In PidNameAcceptLanguage Property] The format of this property [Accept-Language header (2)] is specified in [RFC3282] section 3.
[In PidNameAcceptLanguage Property] The relationship between this property [PidNameAcceptLanguage] and the Accept-Language header (2) is specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] sections 2.1.3.2.16 and 2.2.3.2.11.
[In PidTagPurportedSenderDomain Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagPurportedSenderDomain Property] The PidTagPurportedSenderDomain property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.877) contains the domain name of the last sender responsible for transmitting the current message.
[In PidTagStoreEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagStoreEntryId Property] The PidTagStoreEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1029) contains the unique EntryID of the message store where an object resides.
[In PidTagStoreEntryId Property] The format of this property [EntryID] is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.4.
[In PidTagTrustSender] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagTrustSender] The PidTagTrustSender property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1052) specifies whether the message was delivered through a trusted transport channel.<5>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1713.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagTrustSender] This property [PidTagTrustSender] is a Boolean integer.
[In PidTagTrustSender] Valid values [0x00000000, 0x00000001] are given in the following table [table in section 2.2.1.45].
[In PidTagTrustSender] The value 0x00000000 indicates that Message was not delivered through a trusted transport channel.
[In PidTagTrustSender] The value 0x00000001 indicates that the message was delivered through a trusted transport channel.
[In PidTagSubject Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagSubject Property] The PidTagSubject property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1034) contains the full subject of an e-mail message.

[In PidTagSubject Property] The full subject is a concatenation of the subject prefix, as identified by the PidTagSubjectPrefix property (section 2.2.1.9), and the normalized subject, as identified by the PidTagNormalizedSubject property (section 2.2.1.10).
[In PidTagSubject Property] If the PidTagSubjectPrefix property is not set, the values of the PidTagSubject and PidTagNormalizedSubject properties are equal.
[In PidTagSubject Property] [If the PidTagSubjectPrefix property] is set to an empty string, then the values of the PidTagSubject and PidTagNormalizedSubject properties are equal.
[In PidTagMessageRecipients Property] Type: PtypObject ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagMessageRecipients Property] The PidTagMessageRecipients property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.796) contains a restriction (2) table that can be used to find all messages containing the recipients (2) in a contents table.
[In PidTagMessageRecipients Property] The restriction (2) is a SubObjectRestriction structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.10.

[In PidTagMessageRecipients Property] Messages can be searched with this restriction (2) using the RopSetSearchCriteria ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.4) and the RopRestrict ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.5.3).
[In PidNameContentClass Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidNameContentClass Property] The PidNameContentClass property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.413) contains a string that identifies the type of content of a Message object.
[In PidNameContentClass Property] The value of this property [PidNameContentClass] is as follows: For an E-mail object, the value is as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] section 2.2.3.2.15.

[In PidNameContentClass Property] [The value of property PidNameContentClass is as follows:] For other Message objects, the value is as specified in the technical document that defines the particular Message object.

[In PidNameContentClass Property] [The value of property PidNameContentClass is as follows:] For the Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning Protocol (WebDAV), the value is as specified in the technical document that specifies the particular WebDAV extension.
[In PidTagLocalCommitTime Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagLocalCommitTime Property] The PidTagLocalCommitTime property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.773) specifies the time, in UTC, that the message was last changed.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1890.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagLocalCommitTime Property] The changes include any change to the read state of the message.
[In PidNameContentType Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidNameContentType Property] The PidNameContentType property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.414) contains the value of the Content-Type header (2), which defines the type of the body part's content.
[In PidNameContentType Property] For details about the Content-Type header (2), see [MS-OXCMAIL].
[In PidTagCreatorName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagCreatorName Property] The PidTagCreatorName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.657) specifies the name of the Message object's creator.
[In PidTagMessageAttachments Property] Type: PtypObject ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagMessageAttachments Property] The PidTagMessageAttachments property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.786) contains identifiers that correspond to a message's attachments.
[In PidTagRead Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRead Property] The PidTagRead property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.879) indicates whether a message has been read.
[In PidTagRecipientDisplayName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRecipientDisplayName Property] The PidTagRecipientDisplayName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.900) specifies the display name of a recipient (2).
[In PidTagRecipientEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRecipientEntryId Property] The PidTagRecipientEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.901) contains an EntryID that identifies the Address Book object associated with a recipient (2).
[In Body Properties] Body properties are a group of related properties that specify the body text format and contents and conform to the specification in [MS-OXBBODY].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2053, MS-OXCMSG_R1714, MS-OXCMSG_R2068, MS-OXCMSG_R2072, MS-OXCMSG_R2076, MS-OXCMSG_R2082.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Body Properties] The body properties [PidTagBody, PidTagNativeBody, PidTagBodyHtml, PidTagRtfCompressed, PidTagRtfInSync, PidTagInternetCodepage, PidTagBodyContentId, PidTagBodyContentLocation and PidTagHtml] are valid on any Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2053, MS-OXCMSG_R1714, MS-OXCMSG_R2068, MS-OXCMSG_R2072, MS-OXCMSG_R2076, MS-OXCMSG_R2082.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagBody Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagBody Property] The PidTagBody property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.614) contains unformatted text, which is the text/plain MIME format as specified in [RFC1521] section 7.1.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2058, MS-OXCMSG_R2059, MS-OXCMSG_R2060, MS-OXCMSG_R2061.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagBody Property] Processing of the plain text body from the MIME message format is specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] section 2.1.3.3.1.
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] The PidTagNativeBody property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.806) indicates the best available format for storing the message body<6>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1714.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagNativeBody Property] The value of this property [PidTagNativeBody] is limited to one of the property values [0x00, 0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04] shown in the following table [table in section 2.2.1.49.2].
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] [The value 0x00000000 indicates the best available format for storing the message body is] Undefined body.
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] [The value 0x00000001 indicates the best available format for storing the message body is] Plain text body.
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] [The value 0x00000002 indicates the best available format for storing the message body is] RTF compressed body.
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] [The value 0x00000003 indicates the best available format for storing the message body is] HTML body.
[In PidTagNativeBody Property] [The value 0x00000004 indicates the best available format for storing the message body is] Clear-signed body.
[In PidTagBodyHtml Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagBodyHtml Property] The PidTagBodyHtml property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.621) contains the HTML body as specified in [RFC2822] section 2.3.
[In PidTagRtfCompressed Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRtfCompressed Property] The PidTagRtfCompressed property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.942) contains an RTF body compressed as specified in [MS-OXRTFCP].
[In PidTagRtfInSync Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagRtfInSync Property] The PidTagRtfInSync property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.943) is set to "TRUE" (0x01) if the RTF body has been synchronized with the contents in the PidTagBody property (section 2.2.1.58.1).
[In PidTagInternetCodepage Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagInternetCodepage Property] The PidTagInternetCodepage property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.747) indicates the code page used for the PidTagBody property (section 2.2.1.58.1) or the PidTagBodyHtml property (section 2.2.1.58.3).
[In PidTagBodyContentId Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagBodyContentId Property] The PidTagBodyContentId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.619) contains a GUID corresponding to the current message body.
[In PidTagBodyContentId Property] This property corresponds to the Content-ID header (2).
[In PidTagBodyContentId Property] The relationship between this property and the Content-ID header (2) is further specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] sections 2.1.3.4.2.3 and 2.2.3.2.24.
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] The PidTagBodyContentLocation property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.620) contains a globally unique URI that serves as a label for the current message body.
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] The URI can be either absolute or relative.
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] This property corresponds to the Content-Location header (2).
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] The relationship between this property and the Content-Location header (2) is further specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] sections 2.1.3.4.2.3 and 2.2.3.2.26.
[In PidTagBodyContentLocation Property] The format of this property is further specified in [RFC2110].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R2077.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagHtml Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagHtml Property] [Type] The PidTagHtml property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.734) contains the message body text in HTML format.
[In Contact Linking Properties] Contact linking properties are a group of related properties that are valid on any Message object containing information about the linked Contact objects.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] The PidLidContactLinkEntry property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.71) contains the list of address book EntryIDs linked to by this Message object.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] AddrBookEntryIdCount (4 bytes): The number of address book EntryIDs included in this property.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] FieldSize (4 bytes): The size of the AddrBookEntryIdCount field, minus 4.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] AddrBookEntryIdData (variable): The EntryID data. Repeated the number of times specified by the AddrBookEntryIdCount field.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] [AddrBookEntryIdData] Address book EntryIDs are specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.5.2.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] Padding (3 bytes): Between 0 and 3 bytes of padding, up to the amount required to make the FieldSize field a multiple of 4.
[In PidLidContactLinkEntry Property] [Padding] The value of each padded byte MUST be 0x0000.
[In PidLidContacts Property] Type: PtypMultipleString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidLidContacts Property] The PidLidContacts property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.78) contains the PidTagDisplayName property ([MS-OXOABK] section 2.2.3.1) of each address book EntryID referenced in the value of the PidLidContactLinkEntry property (section 2.2.1.59.1).
[In PidLidContacts Property] This property can also include names not referenced in the PidLidContactLinkEntry property.
[In PidLidContactLinkName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidLidContactLinkName Property] The PidLidContactLinkName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.75) contains the elements of the PidLidContacts property (section 2.2.1.59.2), separated by a semicolon and a space ("; ").
[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] The PidLidContactLinkSearchKey property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.76) contains the list of search keys for the Contact object linked to by this Message object.

[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] Search keys are used to find related objects. Search keys for address book data are further specified by the PidTagSearchKey property ([MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.9).
[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] SearchKeyCount (2 bytes): The number of search keys included in this property.
[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] SearchKeyData (variable): The search keys, up to the number indicated by the ContactEntryCount field.
[In PidLidContactLinkSearchKey Property] [SearchKeyData] Search keys might be a variable size and are null-terminated, as specified in [MS-OXOABK] section 2.2.3.5.
[In Retention and Archive Properties] Retention and archive properties specify information about the retention policy or archive policy.

[In Retention and Archive Properties] These properties [PidTagArchiveTag, PidTagPolicyTag, PidTagRetentionPeriod, PidTagStartDateEtc, PidTagRetentionDate, PidTagRetentionFlags, PidTagArchivePeriod and PidTagArchiveDate] are valid on e-mail Message objects.

[In Retention and Archive Properties] Some of these properties [PidTagArchiveTag, PidTagPolicyTag, PidTagRetentionPeriod, PidTagStartDateEtc, PidTagRetentionDate, PidTagRetentionFlags, PidTagArchivePeriod and PidTagArchiveDate] are also valid on folders.
[In Retention and Archive Properties] The retention policy and the archive policy are independent features.
[In Retention and Archive Properties] The server can enable one of these policies, both of these policies, or neither of them.
[In Retention and Archive Properties] For details about how the retention policy and archive policy settings are communicated between client and server, see [MS-OXOCFG] section 2.2.5.2.3.
[In PidTagArchiveTag Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagArchiveTag Property] The PidTagArchiveTag property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.581) specifies the GUID of an archive tag. The PidTagArchiveTag property can be present on both Message objects and folders and can be set by both client and server.
[In PidTagArchiveTag Property] The PidTagArchiveTag property can be present on Message objects.
[In PidTagArchiveTag Property] [In PidTagArchiveTag Property] The PidTagArchiveTag property can be present on folders.
[In PidTagArchiveTag Property] can be set by client.
[In PidTagPolicyTag Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagPolicyTag Property] The PidTagPolicyTag property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.864) specifies the GUID of a retention tag.
[In PidTagPolicyTag Property] The PidTagPolicyTag property can be present on Message objects.
[In PidTagPolicyTag Property] The PidTagPolicyTag property can be present on folders.
[In PidTagPolicyTag Property] [The PidTagPolicyTag property] can be set by client.
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] The PidTagRetentionPeriod property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.935) specifies the number of days that a Message object can be retained.
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] The PidTagRetentionPeriod property can be present on Message objects.
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] The PidTagRetentionPeriod property can be present on folders.
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] [The PidTagRetentionPeriod property] can be set by client.

[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] The presence of the PidTagRetentionPeriod property on a Message object indicates that the retention tag on that Message object was explicitly applied by the end user.
[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] If the value of the PidTagRetentionPeriod property is 0, the Message object never expires.

[In PidTagRetentionPeriod Property] When the PidTagRetentionPeriod property is present on a folder, it [PidTagRetentionPeriod] has no special significance; it [PidTagRetentionPeriod] simply specifies the retention period that corresponds to the retention tag on that folder.
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] The PidTagStartDateEtc property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1027) has the following structure [Default retention period, Start date].
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] The length of Default retention period is 4 bytes.
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] [Default retention period] A default retention tag is applied to a Message object when a regular retention tag is not present on the Message object.
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] [Default retention period] The absence of a regular retention tag indicates that the Message object does not have a specific retention policy.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R2128.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] [Default retention period] The application of the default tag is based on the Message object's message class.)
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] [The length of] Start date [is 8 bytes], [which contains] The date, in UTC, from which the age of the Message object is calculated.
[In PidTagStartDateEtc Property] The PidTagStartDateEtc property can be present only on Message objects.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The PidTagRetentionDate property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.933) specifies the date, in UTC, after which a Message object is expired by the server.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The PidTagRetentionDate property can be present only on Message objects.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The PidTagRetentionDate property can not be present on folders.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] If the property is not present, the Message object never expires.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The PidTagRetentionDate property can be set by both client and server.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] [The PidTagRetentionDate property can be set by] server.
[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The value of the PidTagRetentionDate property is calculated from the values of other properties.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2145, MS-OXCMSG_R2146.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The values used in the calculation depend on whether the Message object has a specific retention policy.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2145, MS-OXCMSG_R2146.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRetentionDate Property] A Message object will have the default retention policy in the absence of a specific retention policy.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R2128.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRetentionDate Property] The explicit method of calculation is as follows: [When the Message object has a specific Retention Policy and When the Message object has the default Retention Policy].

[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] [When the Message object has a specific Retention Policy] PidTagRetentionDate = PidTagMessageDeliveryTime ([MS-OXOMSG] section 2.2.3.9) + PidTagRetentionPeriod (section 2.2.1.60.3).

[In PidTagRetentionDate Property] [When the Message object has a specific Retention Policy] If the PidTagMessageDeliveryTime property does not exist, the PidTagCreationTime property (section 2.2.2.3) is used.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] The PidTagRetentionFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.934) contains flags that specify the status or nature of an item's retention tag or archive tag.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R2154, MS-OXCMSG_R2155, MS-OXCMSG_R2156, MS-OXCMSG_R2157, MS-OXCMSG_R2158, MS-OXCMSG_R2159, MS-OXCMSG_R2160.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] The PidTagRetentionFlags property can be present on Message objects.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] The PidTagRetentionFlags property can be present on folders.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [The PidTagRetentionFlags property] can be set by client.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [The PidTagRetentionFlags property can be set by] server.

[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] The value of the PidTagRetentionFlags property [0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000004, 0x00000008, 0x000000010, 0x000000020, 0x000000040, 0x00000080, 0x00000100] is a bitwise OR of zero or more of the values from the following table [table in section 2.2.1.51.6].
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [ExplicitTag (0x00000001)] The retention tag on the folder is explicitly set.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [UserOverride (0x00000002)] The retention tag was not changed by the end user.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [AutoTag (0x00000004)] The retention tag on the Message object is an autotag, which is predicted by the system.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [PersonalTag (0x00000008)] The retention tag on the folder is of a personal type and can be made available to the end user.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [ExplicitArchiveTag (0x00000010)] The archive tag on the folder is explicitly set.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [KeepInPlace (0x00000020)] The Message object remains in place and is not archived.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [SystemData (0x00000040)] The Message object or folder is system data.
[In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [NeedsRescan<7> (0x00000080)] The folder needs to be rescanned.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1909.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagRetentionFlags Property] [PendingRescan<8> (0x00000100)] The folder is being rescanned.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1911.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] The PidTagArchivePeriod property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.580) specifies the number of days that a Message object can remain unarchived.
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] The PidTagArchivePeriod property can be present on Message objects.
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] The PidTagArchivePeriod property can be present on folders.
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] [The PidTagArchivePeriod property] can be set by client.
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] [The PidTagArchivePeriod property can be set by] server
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] The presence of the PidTagArchivePeriod property on a Message object indicates that the archive tag on that Message object was explicitly applied by the end user.
[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] If the value of PidTagArchivePeriod is 0, the Message object is never archived by the server.

[In PidTagArchivePeriod Property] When the PidTagArchivePeriod property is present on a folder, it has no special significance; it simply specifies the archive period that corresponds to the archive tag on that folder.
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] The PidTagArchiveDate property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.575) spec3fies the date, in UTC, after which a Message object is archived by the server.
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] The PidTagArchiveDate property can be present on only Message objects, not on folders.
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] The PidTagArchiveDate property can not be present on folders.
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] [The PidTagArchiveDate property] can be set by client.
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] [Type] server
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] [Type] If the PidTagArchiveDate property is not present, the Message object is never archived by the server.

[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] The value of the PidTagArchiveDate property is calculated from the values of other properties as follows: PidTagArchiveDate = start date + PidTagArchivePeriod (section 2.2.1.60.7).
[In PidTagArchiveDate Property] The start date is obtained from the last eight bytes of the PidTagStartDateEtc property (section 2.2.1.60.4).
[In PidNameMSIPLabels Property] Type: PtypString [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1.
[In PidNameMSIPLabels Property] The PidNameMSIPLabels property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.460) contains the string that specifies the CLP Labels information.
[In PidTagClientActivelyEditingUntil Property] Type: PtypTime ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagClientActivelyEditingUntil Property] The PidTagClientActivelyEditingUntil property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.635) specifies the date and time, in UTC, until which time the client expects to be actively editing the object.
[In General Properties] The following properties [PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagObjectType and PidTagRecordKey] exist on any Attachment object.
[In General Properties] Property PidTagAccessLevel exists on Attachment object.
[In General Properties] Property PidTagRecordKey exists on Attachment object.
[In General Properties] Property PidTagObjectType<9> exists on Attachment object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R3008.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In General Properties] These properties [PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagObjectType and PidTagRecordKey] are set by the server.
[In General Properties] These properties [PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagObjectType and PidTagRecordKey] are read-only for the client.
[In General Properties] For specifications of these properties see [MS-OXCPRPT] [PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagObjectType and PidTagRecordKey].
[In PidTagLastModificationTime Property] Type: PtypTime, in UTC ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagLastModificationTime Property] The PidTagLastModificationTime property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.765) indicates the last time the file referenced by the Attachment object was modified.
[In PidTagLastModificationTime Property] [The PidTagLastModificationTime property indicates] the last time the Attachment object itself was modified.
[In PidTagCreationTime Property] Type: PtypTime, in UTC ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagCreationTime Property] Indicates the time the file referenced by the Attachment object was created, or the time the Attachment object itself was created.
[In PidTagDisplayName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagDisplayName Property] The PidTagDisplayName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.677) contains the name of the attachment as input by the end user.
[In PidTagDisplayName Property] This property is set to the same value as the PidTagAttachLongFilename property (section 2.2.2.13).
[In PidTagAttachSize Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachSize Property] The PidTagAttachSize property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.608) contains the size in bytes consumed by the Attachment object on the server.
[In PidTagAttachSize Property] This property [PidTagAttachSize] is read-only for the client.
[In PidTagAttachNumber Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachNumber Property] The PidTagAttachNumber property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.603) identifies the Attachment object within its Message object.
[In PidTagAttachNumber Property] The value of this property [PidTagAttachNumber] MUST be unique among the Attachment objects in a message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1836.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachNumber Property] The value of property PidTagAttachNumber is different among the two Attachment objects in a message.
[In PidTagAttachDataBinary Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachDataBinary Property] The PidTagAttachDataBinary property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.589) contains the contents of the file to be attached.
[In PidTagAttachDataObject Property] Type: PtypObject ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachDataObject Property] The PidTagAttachDataObject property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.590) contains the binary representation of the Attachment object in an application-specific format.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] The PidTagAttachMethod property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.601) represents the way the contents of an attachment are accessed.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R588, MS-OXCMSG_R590, MS-OXCMSG_R592, MS-OXCMSG_R594, MS-OXCMSG_R596.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachMethod Property] This property [PidTagAttachMethod] is set to one of the following values [0x00000000, 0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000004, 0x00000005, 0x00000006,0x00000007].
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afNone (0x00000000)] The attachment has just been created.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afByValue (0x00000001)] The PidTagAttachDataBinary property (section 2.2.2.7) contains the attachment data.

[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afByReference (0x00000002)] The PidTagAttachLongPathname property (section 2.2.2.13) contains a fully qualified path identifying the attachment To recipients with access to a common file server.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afByReferenceOnly (0x00000004)] The PidTagAttachLongPathname property contains a fully qualified path identifying the attachment.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afEmbeddedMessage (0x00000005)] The attachment is an embedded message that is accessed via the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16).
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afStorage (0x00000006)] The PidTagAttachDataObject property (section 2.2.2.8) contains data in an application-specific format.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afByWebReference (0x00000007)] The PidTagAttachLongPathname property contains a fully qualified path identifying the attachment.
[In PidTagAttachMethod Property] [afByWebReference (0x00000007)] The PidNameAttachmentProviderType defines the web service API manipulating the attachment.
[In PidTagAttachLongFilename Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachLongFilename Property] The PidTagAttachLongFilename property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.595) contains the full file name and extension of the Attachment object.
[In PidTagAttachFilename Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachFilename Property] The PidTagAttachFilename property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.593) contains the 8.3 name of the value of the PidTagAttachLongFilename property (section 2.2.2.10).
[In PidTagAttachExtension Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachExtension Property] The PidTagAttachExtension property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.592) contains a file name extension that indicates the document type of an attachment.
[In PidTagAttachLongPathname Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachLongPathname Property] The PidTagAttachLongPathname property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.596) contains the fully qualified path and file name with extension.
[In PidTagAttachPathname Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachPathname Property] The PidTagAttachPathname property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.604) contains the 8.3 name of the value of the PidTagAttachLongPathname property (section 2.2.2.13).
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] The PidTagAttachTag property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.609) contains the identifier information for the application that supplied the Attachment object's data.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R612.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachTag Property] This property can be left unset; if set, it [PidTagAttachTag] MUST be one of the following [TNEF, afStorage, MIME].
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] The data of TNEF is {0x2A,86,48,86,F7,14,03,0A,01}.
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] TNEF: The TNEF format is specified in [MS-OXTNEF].
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] The data of afStorage is {0x2A,86,48,86,F7,14,03,0A,03,02,01}.
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] afStorage: Data is in an application-specific format.
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] The data of MIME is {0x2A,86,48,86,F7,14,03,0A,04}.
[In PidTagAttachTag Property] MIME: Conversion between Message object and MIME formats is specified in [MS-OXCMAIL].
[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] Type: PtypInteger32, unsigned ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] The PidTagRenderingPosition property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.915) represents an offset, in rendered characters, to use when rendering an attachment within the main message text.
[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] The values specify a relative ordering of the rendered attachment in the text.

[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] If a message has three attachments with values of 200, 100, and 500 for the PidTagRenderingPosition property, these will be rendered in the same order as if the attachments had the values 2, 1, and 5.
[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] A detailed example of this property is provided in [MS-OXRTFEX] section 3.2.
[In PidTagRenderingPosition Property] The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates a hidden attachment that is not to be rendered in the main text.
[In PidTagAttachRendering Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagAttachRendering Property] The PidTagAttachRendering property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.607) contains a Windows Metafile Format (WMF) metafile as specified in [MS-WMF] for the Attachment object.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32, as a bit field ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] The PidTagAttachFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.594) indicates which body formats might reference this attachment when rendering data.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R971, MS-OXCMSG_R972, MS-OXCMSG_R973.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachFlags Property] This property [PidTagAttachFlags] contains a bitwise OR of zero or more of the following flags [0x00000001, 0x00000002 and 0x00000004].
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] If this property [PidTagAttachFlags] is absent or its value is 0x00000000, the attachment is available to be rendered in any format.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [The value of attInvisibleInHtml is] 0x00000001.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [attInvisibleInHtml (0x00000001)] The Attachment object is not available to be rendered in HTML.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [The value of attInvisibleInRtf is] 0x00000002.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [attInvisibleInRtf (0x00000002)] The Attachment object is not available to be rendered in RTF.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [The value of attRenderedInBody is] 0x00000004.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [attRenderedInBody (0x00000004)] The Attachment object is referenced and rendered within the HTML body of the associated Message object.
[In PidTagAttachFlags Property] [attRenderedInBody (0x00000004)] More details about attRenderedInBody are specified in the PidTagBodyHtml property (section 2.2.1.58.3).
[In PidTagAttachTransportName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagAttachTransportName Property] The PidTagAttachTransportName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.610) contains the name of an attachment file, modified so that it can be correlated with TNEF messages, as specified in [MS-OXTNEF].
[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] The PidTagAttachEncoding property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.591) contains encoding information about the Attachment object.
[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] If the attachment is in MacBinary format, this property [PidTagAttachEncoding] is set to "{0x2A,86,48,86,F7,14,03,0B,01}".
[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] otherwise [If the attachment isn't in MacBinary format], it [PidTagAttachEncoding] is unset.

[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] This property [PidTagAttachEncoding] is used to indicate that the attachment content, which is the value of the PidTagAttachDataBinary property (section 2.2.2.7), MUST be encoded in the MacBinary format, as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL].
[In PidTagAttachEncoding Property] Clients SHOULD<10> correctly detect MacBinary I, MacBinaryII, and MacBinary III formats.
[In PidTagAttachAdditionalInformation Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagAttachAdditionalInformation Property] The PidTagAttachAdditionalInformation property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.585) MUST be set to an empty string if the PidTagAttachEncoding property (section 2.2.2.20) is unset.

[In PidTagAttachAdditionalInformation Property] If the PidTagAttachEncoding property is set, the PidTagAttachAdditionalInformation property MUST be set to a string of the format ":CREA:TYPE", where ":CREA" is the four-letter Macintosh file creator code, and ":TYPE" is a four-letter Macintosh type code.
[In PidTagAttachmentLinkId Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachmentLinkId Property] The PidTagAttachmentLinkId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.600) is the type of Message object to which this attachment is linked.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R634.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachmentLinkId Property] This property [PidTagAttachmentLinkId] MUST be set to 0x00000000 unless overridden by other protocols that extend the Message and Attachment Object Protocol as noted in section 1.4.
[In PidTagAttachmentFlags Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachmentFlags Property] The PidTagAttachmentFlags property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.598) indicates special handling for this Attachment object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R637.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagAttachmentFlags Property] This property [PidTagAttachmentFlags] MUST be set to 0x00000000 unless overridden by other protocols that extend the Message and Attachment Object Protocol as noted in section 1.4.
[In PidTagAttachmentHidden Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagAttachmentHidden Property] The PidTagAttachmentHidden property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.599) is set to TRUE (0x01) if this Attachment object is hidden from the end user.
[In PidTagTextAttachmentCharset Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagTextAttachmentCharset Property] The PidTagTextAttachmentCharset property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1045) specifies the character set (2) of messages for messages with a text body.

[In PidTagTextAttachmentCharset Property] This property [PidTagTextAttachmentCharset] corresponds to the charset parameter of the Content-Type header (2), as specified in [MS-OXCMAIL] section 2.2.3.4.1.2.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] The PidNameAttachmentProviderType property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.373) contains the type of web service manipulating the attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentProviderType is] OneDrivePro.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] [PidNameAttachmentProviderType (OneDrivePro) measns] The web reference attachment belongs to a OneDrive for Business service.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentProviderType is] OneDriveConsumer.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] [PidNameAttachmentProviderType (OneDriveConsumer) measns] The web reference attachment belongs to a OneDrive Consumer service.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] The PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.371) contains the original permission type data associated with a web reference attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType is] 0.
[In PidNameAttachmentProviderType Property] [PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType (0) measns] None. User has no permissions to share.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType is] 1.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType (1) measns] View. User can only read the web reference attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType is] 2.
[In PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType Property] [PidNameAttachmentOriginalPermissionType (2) measns] Edit. User can edit the web reference attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] The PidNameAttachmentPermissionType property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.372) contains the permission type data [0,1,2]associated with a web reference attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentPermissionType is] 0.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [PidNameAttachmentPermissionType (0) measns] None. User has no permissions to share.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentProviderType is] 1.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [PidNameAttachmentPermissionType (1) measns] View. User can only read the web reference attachment.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [The value of PidNameAttachmentPermissionType is] 2.
[In PidNameAttachmentPermissionType Property] [PidNameAttachmentPermissionType (2) measns] Edit. User can edit the web reference attachment.

[In MIME properties] The following properties [PidTagAttachMimeTag, PidTagAttachContentId, PidTagAttachContentLocation, PidTagAttachContentBase, PidTagAttachPayloadClass, PidTagAttachPayloadProviderGuidString, PidNameAttachmentMacContentType and PidNameAttachmentMacInfo] can be left unset.

[In MIME Properties] The following properties [PidTagAttachMimeTag, PidTagAttachContentId, PidTagAttachContentLocation, PidTagAttachContentBase, PidTagAttachPayloadClass, PidTagAttachPayloadProviderGuidString, PidNameAttachmentMacContentType and PidNameAttachmentMacInfo] contain MIME information.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R963, MS-OXCMSG_R964, MS-OXCMSG_R965, MS-OXCMSG_R967, MS-OXCMSG_R1284, MS-OXCMSG_R1286, MS-OXCMSG_R1287, MS-OXCMSG_R1288.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In MIME properties] For details about MIME specifications, see [RFC2045].

[In MIME properties] For the specification on mapping these properties [PidTagAttachMimeTag, PidTagAttachContentId, PidTagAttachContentLocation, PidTagAttachContentBase, PidTagAttachPayloadClass, PidTagAttachPayloadProviderGuidString, PidNameAttachmentMacContentType and PidNameAttachmentMacInfo], see [MS-OXCMAIL].
[In MIME Properties] The types [PtypString and PtypBinary] in the following table are specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1.
[In MIME properties] The type of PidTagAttachMimeTag ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.602) is PtypString.
[In MIME Properties] PidTagAttachMimeTag: The Content-Type header (2).
[In MIME Properties] The type of PidTagAttachContentId ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.587) is PtypString.
[In MIME properties] PidTagAttachContentId: A content identifier unique to this Message object that matches a corresponding "cid:" URI scheme reference in the HTML body of the Message object.
[In MIME Properties] The type of PidTagAttachContentLocation ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.588) is PtypString.
[In MIME properties] PidTagAttachContentLocation: A relative or full URI that matches a corresponding reference in the HTML body of the Message object.
[In MIME properties] PtypString: The base of a relative URI.
[In MIME Properties] The type of PidTagAttachContentBase ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.586) is PtypString.
[In MIME Properties] PidTagAttachContentBase: The base of a relative URI.
[In MIME properties] [PidTagAttachContentBase] MUST be set if the PidTagAttachContentLocation property contains a relative URI.
[In MIME Properties] The type of PidTagAttachPayloadClass ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.605 is PtypString.
[In MIME Properties] PidTagAttachPayloadClass: The class name of an object that can display the contents of the message.
