[In MIME Properties] The type of PidTagAttachPayloadProviderGuidString ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.606 is PtypString.
[In MIME Properties] PidTagAttachPayloadProviderGuidString: The GUID of the software application that can display the contents of the message.
[In MIME Properties] The type of PidNameAttachmentMacContentType ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.368) is PtypString.
[In MIME Properties] PidNameAttachmentMacContentType: The Content-Type header (2) of the Macintosh attachment.
[In MIME Properties] The type of PtypBinary PidNameAttachmentMacInfo ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.369) is PtypBinary.
[In MIME Properties] PidNameAttachmentMacInfo: The headers (2) and resource fork data associated with the Macintosh attachment.

[In Message Object ROPS] The following sections [subsections of section 2.2.3] specify the format of the ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers specific to the Message and Attachment Object Protocol.
[In Message Object ROPS] Before sending these requests to the server, the client has logged on to the server and acquired a handle to the Message object or Folder object used in the ROP request.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP] The RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1) provides access to an existing Message object, which is identified by the message ID (MID), whose structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2.<11>
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] The folder containing the Message object is identified by the folder ID (FID), whose structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] For this ROP [RopOpenMessage], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references either a Store object or a Folder object.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] If a folder is used, it is not necessary that it [Folder object] is the parent folder, only that it [Folder object] is a folder within the same store.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] The value of the OutputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopOpenMessage ROP] This section [section RopOpenMessage] specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [CodePageId, FolderID and OpenModeFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] CodePageId: 2 bytes specifying the code page in which the non-Unicode representation of the strings on this Message object are encoded.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [CodePageId] A value of 0x0FFF means that the code page of the Logon object is used.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] FolderID: 8 bytes containing the FID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) of the folder from which the message is to be opened.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlag: [The size of OpenModeFlag is] 1 byte.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] The values [0x00, 0x01, 0x03, 0x04] given in the following table are valid.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] If other bits [the values isn't 0x00, 0x01, 0x03 and 0x04] are set, they are ignored.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1838.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] The server responses are same when OpenModeFlags are set with two different values, and the two different values are not one of 0x00, 0x01, 0x03 and 0x04.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [ReadOnly (0x00)] Message will be opened as read only.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [ReadWrite (0x01)] Message will be opened for both reading and writing.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [BestAccess (0x03)] Open for read/write if the user has write permissions for the folder.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [BestAccess (0x03)] It is read-only if the user don't have write permissions.<12>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R3009, MS-OXCMSG_R3010.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [OpenSoftDeleted (0x04)] Open a soft deleted Message object if available.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [HasNamedProperties, SubjectPrefix, NormalizedSubject, RecipientCount, ColumnCount, RecipientColumns, RowCount and RecipientRows] for the response buffer of the RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] HasNamedProperties: 1 byte.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [HasNamedProperties] 0x00: No named properties are defined for this Message object.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [HasNamedProperties] Nonzero: Named properties are defined for this Message object and can be obtained through a RopGetPropertiesAll ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.4).
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [HasNamedProperties] Nonzero: Named properties can consist of custom properties added and maintained by third-party applications.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] SubjectPrefix: A TypedString structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.7) specifying the prefix for the subject of the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R676.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [SubjectPrefix] The SubjectPrefix field contains the value of the PidTagSubjectPrefix property (section 2.2.1.9).
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] NormalizedSubject: A TypedString structure specifying the normalized subject of the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R678.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [NormalizedSubject] The NormalizedSubject field contains the value of the PidTagNormalizedSubject property (section 2.2.1.10).
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] RecipientCount: A 2-byte unsigned integer containing the number of recipients (2) associated with the Message object.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] ColumnCount: A 2-BYTE unsigned integer containing the number of elements in the RecipientColumns field.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] RecipientColumns: An array of PropertyTag structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.9) with the number of elements specified in the ColumnCount field.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientColumns] Each PropertyTag value is valid for a recipient (2) as specified in [MS-OXPROPS].
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] RowCount: A 1-byte unsigned integer containing the number of rows in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RowCount] The value MUST be less than or equal to the RecipientCount field.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] RecipientRows: An array of OpenRecipientRow structures whose number is equal to the value of the RowCount field.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value of the RecipientType field specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1.2.1 is a bitwise OR of zero or one value [0x01, 0x02, 0x03] from the Types table with zero or more values [0x10, 0x80] from the flags table.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] Valid values [0x01, 0x02 and 0x03] for the RecipientType field are given in the following table [valid values table in section 2.2.3.1.2].
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value 0x01 means Primary recipient.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value 0x02 means Carbon copy (Cc) recipient.
[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value 0x03 means Blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipient.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value 0x10 means when resending a previous failure, this flag indicates that this recipient (1) did not successfully receive the message on the previous attempt.

[In RopOpenMessage ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The value 0x80 means that when resending a previous failure, this flag indicates that this recipient (1) did successfully receive the message on the previous attempt.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP] The RopCreateMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2) is used to create a new Message object.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP] For this ROP [RopCreateMessage], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a folder or Logon object.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP] The value of the OutputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopCreateMessage ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [CodePageId, FolderId and AssociatedFlag] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopCreateMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2).
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] CodePageId: 2 bytes specifying the code page with which the non-Unicode representation of the strings on this Message object are to be encoded.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] [CodePageId] A value of 0x0FFF means that the code page of the Logon object is used.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: 8 bytes containing the FID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) for the Folder object in which the Message object is to be created.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] AssociatedFlag: 1 byte Boolean value.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] AssociatedFlag: The value is one of the following [0x00, non-zero].
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] [AssociatedFlag] Value 0x00 means the message to be created is not an FAI message.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Request Buffer] [AssociatedFlag] Nonzero means the message to be created is an FAI message.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [HasMessageId, MessageId] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopCreateMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2).
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Response Buffer] HasMessageId: The size of HasMessageId is 1 byte.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Response Buffer] [HasMessageId] The value 0x00 means this is the last byte in the buffer.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Response Buffer] [HasMessageId] The value of Nonzero means the MessageId field follows beginning with the next byte in the buffer.
[In RopCreateMessage ROP Response Buffer] MessageId: 8 bytes containing the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the newly created Message object.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP] The RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) commits the changes made to the Message object.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP] For this ROP [RopSaveChangesMessage], the value of the ResponseHandleIndex field references the containing Folder object or, for an embedded message, the Embedded Message object.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP] The value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [SaveFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3).
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] SaveFlags: 1 byte indicating the server save behavior.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] this field MUST be set to one of the flags [0x09, 0x0A, 0x0C] specified in the following table [table in section 2.2.3.3.1].
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] Other flags [not 0x01, 0x02 or 0x04] are not valid and are ignored by the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1907.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] The server's responses are same with two different values [not 0x01, 0x02 or 0x04] of SaveFlags.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadOnly (0x01)] The client requests that the server commit the changes.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadOnly (0x01)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP failed] The server returns an error and leaves the Message object open with unchanged access level.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadOnly (0x01)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP succeeded] The server returns a success code and keeps the Message object open with read-only access. <13>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R2192,MS-OXCMSG_R2193

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadOnly (0x01)] More details about access levels are specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.1.2.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadWrite (0x02)] The client requests that the server commit the changes.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadWrite (0x02)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP failed] The server returns an error and leaves the Message object open with unchanged access level.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [KeepOpenReadWrite (0x02)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP succeeded] The server returns a success code and keeps the Message object open with read/write access.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] The value of ForceSave is 0x04 <14>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R3011, MS-OXCMSG_R3022.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [ForceSave (0x04)] The client requests that the server commit the changes.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [ForceSave (0x04)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP failed] The server returns an error and leaves the Message object open with unchanged access level.

[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [ForceSave (0x04)] [If the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP succeeded] The server returns a success code and keeps the Message object open with read/write access.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request Buffer] [SaveFlags] [ForceSave (0x04)] The ecObjectModified error code is not valid when this flag [ForceSave] is set; the server overwrites any changes instead.
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageId] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3).
[In RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Response Buffer] Message Id: 8 bytes containing the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the saved Message object.
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP] The client sends the RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.4) to delete all recipients (2) from a message.
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP] For this ROP [RopRemoveAllRecipients], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [Reserved] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.4).
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Request Buffer] Reserved: 4-bytes.
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Request Buffer] [Reserved] [It is an] unspecified value.
[In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.4.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2005, MS-OXCROPS_R1842, MS-OXCROPS_R1844, MS-OXCROPS_R1845, MS-OXCROPS_R1846, MS-OXCROPS_R1848.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP response buffer.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP] The RopModifyRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5) modifies recipients (2) associated with the Message object.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP] For this ROP [RopModifyRecipients], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP [RopModifyRecipients] is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [ColumnCount, RecipientColumns, RowCount and RecipientRow] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopModifyRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5).
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] ColumnCount: 2 bytes containing the number of elements in the RecipientColumns field.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] [ColumnCount] Is greater than or equal to "0x0000" and less than 0x7FEF.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] RecipientColumns: An array of PropertyTag structures whose number is equal to the value of the ColumnCount field.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] [RecipientColumns] Each element is valid for a recipient as specified in [MS-OXPROPS].
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] RowCount: 2 bytes containing the number of elements in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] The value of this field [RowCount] is greater than or equal to 0x0000 and less than 0x7FEF.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Request Buffer] RecipientRows: An array of ModifyRecipientRow structures ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5.1.1) whose length equals the value of the RowCount field.
[In RopModifyRecipients ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopModifyRecipients ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R1883, MS-OXCROPS_R1885, MS-OXCROPS_R1886, MS-OXCROPS_R1887, MS-OXCROPS_R1889.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopModifyRecipients ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopModifyRecipients ROP response buffer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP] The RopReadRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6) retrieves the recipients (2) associated with the Message object.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP] For this ROP [RopReadRecipients], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopReadRecipients ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [RowId] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopReadRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6).
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer] RowId: 4 bytes containing the starting index for the recipients (2) to be retrieved.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer] Reserved: 2 bytes; MUST be 0x0000.

[In RopReadRecipients ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [RowCount, RecipientRows] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopReadRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6).
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Response Buffer] RowCount: 1 byte containing the number of elements in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Response Buffer] [RowCount] Is greater than or equal to 0x00 and less than 0xFF.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Response Buffer] RecipientRows: An array of ReadRecipientRow structures whose number of elements equals the RowCount field.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Response Buffer] [RecipientRows] The ReadRecipientRow structure is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6.2.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R1920, MS-OXCROPS_R1922, MS-OXCROPS_R1923, MS-OXCROPS_R1925, MS-OXCROPS_R1927, MS-OXCROPS_R1928, MS-OXCROPS_R1929, MS-OXCROPS_R1931, MS-OXCROPS_R1933.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] The RopReloadCachedInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.7) retrieves the same information as RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1) but operates on an already opened Message object.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] For this ROP [RopReloadCachedInformation], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [Reserved] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopReloadCachedInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.7).
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer] Reserved: 2-bytes; MUST be 0x0000.

[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopReloadCachedInformation ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.7) is identical to the syntax of the RopOpenMessage ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R1692, MS-OXCROPS_R1694, MS-OXCROPS_R1695, MS-OXCROPS_R1696, MS-OXCROPS_R1698, MS-OXCROPS_R1702, MS-OXCROPS_R1703, MS-OXCROPS_R1705, MS-OXCROPS_R1708, MS-OXCROPS_R1711, MS-OXCROPS_R1713, MS-OXCROPS_R1715, MS-OXCROPS_R1716, MS-OXCROPS_R1718, MS-OXCROPS_R1719, MS-OXCROPS_R1721, MS-OXCROPS_R1722, MS-OXCROPS_R1736, MS-OXCROPS_R1738, MS-OXCROPS_R1739, MS-OXCROPS_R1740, MS-OXCROPS_R1742, MS-OXCROPS_R1744, MS-OXCROPS_R1956, MS-OXCROPS_R1958, MS-OXCROPS_R1959, MS-OXCROPS_R1960, MS-OXCROPS_R1962, MS-OXCROPS_R1964, MS-OXCROPS_R1965, MS-OXCROPS_R1967, MS-OXCROPS_R1970, MS-OXCROPS_R1973, MS-OXCROPS_R1975, MS-OXCROPS_R1977, MS-OXCROPS_R1978, MS-OXCROPS_R1981, MS-OXCROPS_R1983, MS-OXCROPS_R1984, MS-OXCROPS_R1986, MS-OXCROPS_R1988, MS-OXCROPS_R1989, MS-OXCROPS_R1990, MS-OXCROPS_R1992, MS-OXCROPS_R1994.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] The RopSetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8) sets the PidTagMessageStatus property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.799) on a message in a folder without the need to open or save the Message object.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] For this ROP [RopSetMessageStatus], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Folder object.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageId, MessageStatusFlags and MessageStatusMask] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8).
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] MessageId: 8 bytes containing the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the Message object to modify.

[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] MessageStatusFlags: 4 bytes containing the PidTagMessageStatus property (section 2.2.1.8), which defines the status of the message in a contents table. Valid values are specified in section 2.2.1.8.

[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] [MessageStatusFlags] This value of this field [MessageStatusFlags] is combined with the value of the MessageStatusMask field to yield the new message status.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] MessageStatusMask: 4 bytes indicating which status flags are to be set and which are to be cleared.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] [MessageStatusMask] This field contains a bitwise OR of zero or more values from the table in section 2.2.1.8.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] [MessageStatusMask] Processing information for this field is specified in section 3.2.5.8.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageStatusFlags] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8).
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] MessageStatusFlags: 4 bytes indicating the status flags that were set on the Message object before processing this request.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] [MessageStatusFlags] This field MUST contain a bitwise OR of zero or more values from the table in section 2.2.1.8.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] The RopGetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9) gets the message status of a message in a folder.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] For this ROP [RopGetMessageStatus], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Folder object.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageId] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9).
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] MessageId: 8 bytes containing the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the Message object in which to operate.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageStatusFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9).
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] MessageStatusFlags: 4 bytes indicating the status of the Message object.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffer] [MessageStatusFlags] This field contains a bitwise OR of zero or more values from the table in section 2.2.1.8.

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] The RopSetReadFlags ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10) changes the state of the PidTagMessageFlags property (section 2.2.1.6) on one or more Message objects within a Folder object.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] It [the RopSetReadFlags ROP] also triggers the sending of read receipts, as specified in [MS-OXOMSG].
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] For this ROP [RopSetReadFlags], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Folder object.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [WantAsynchronous, ReadFlags, MessageIdCount and MessageIds] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSetReadFlags ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10).

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous: 1 byte indicating whether client is prepared for the RopSetReadFlags ROP request to be processed asynchronously with status reported via the RopProgress ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.13).

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] ReadFlags: 1 byte containing a bitwise OR of zero or more values [rfDefault, rfSuppressReceipt, rfReserved, rfClearReadFlag, rfGenerateReceiptOnly, rfClearNotifyRead, rfClearNotifyUnread] from the following table.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] The server modifies bits on the PidTagMessageFlags property (section 2.2.1.6).
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] The flags, rfGenerateReceiptOnly, rfsuppressReceipt, and rfClearReadFlag, (rfClearNotifyRead or rfClearNotifyUnread), are mutually exclusive.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfDefault (0x00)] The server sets the read flag and sends the receipt.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfSuppressReceipt (0x01)] The user requests that any pending read receipt be canceled.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfSuppressReceipt (0x01)] The server sets the mfRead bit.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfReserved (0x0A)] Ignored by the server.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfClearReadFlag (0x04)] Server clears the mfRead bit.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfClearReadFlag (0x04)] The client MUST include the rfSuppressReceipt bit with this flag [ReadFlags].
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfGenerateReceiptOnly (0x10)] The server sends a read receipt if one is pending, but does not change the mfRead bit.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfClearNotifyRead (0x20)] The server clears the mfNotifyRead bit but does not send a read receipt.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] [ReadFlags] [rfClearNotifyUnread (0x40)] The server clears the mfNotifyUnread bit but does not send a nonread receipt.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] MessageIdCount: 2 bytes containing the number of elements in the MessageIds field.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] MessageIds: An array of MIDs ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) whose length is equal to the value of the MessageIdCount field.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [PartialCompletion] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSetReadFlags ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10).
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer] PartialCompletion: 1 byte boolean flag.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer] [PartialCompletion] A nonzero value indicates the server was unable to modify one or more of the Message objects represented in the MessageIds field.<15>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R3021.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] The RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.11) changes the state of the PidTagMessageFlags property (section 2.2.1.6) for the Message object.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] It [the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] also triggers the sending of read receipts, as specified in [MS-OXOMSG].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] In this section, "in public folder mode" means that the logon associated with the value of the LogonID field from the request was created with the Private flag unset.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] For this ROP [RopSetMessageReadFlag], the value of the ResponseHandleIndex field references a Folder object.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] The value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [ReadFlags, ClientData] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.11).
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer] ReadFlags: 1 byte containing a bitwise OR of one or more values from the ReadFlags field table in section 2.2.3.10.1.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer] ClientData: A 24 byte LongTermID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1, that represents the message read when in public folder mode.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer] [ClientData] 0 bytes otherwise [represents the message read when it is not in public folder mode].

[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [ReadStatusChanged, LogonId and ClientData] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.11).
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] ReadStatusChanged: 1 byte containing one of the following values [0x00, Nonzero].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] [ReadStatusChanged] [The value 0x00 indicates that] The read status on the Message object was unchanged.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] [ReadStatusChanged] [The value 0x00 indicates that] the logon is not in public folder mode.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] [ReadStatusChanged] [The value non-zero indicates that] The read status on the Message object changed and the logon is in public folder mode.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] LogonId: 1 byte containing the LogonID from the request when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is nonzero.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] [LogonId] 0 bytes otherwise [when the value in ReadStatusChanged is zero].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] ClientData: 24 bytes containing the ClientData field from the request when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is nonzero.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Response Buffer] [ClientData] 0 bytes otherwise [when the value in ReadStatusChanged is zero].
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] The RopOpenAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.12) opens an Attachment object stored on the Message object.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] For this ROP [RopOpenAttachment], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] [For ROP RopOpenAttachment], the value of the OutputHandleIndex field references an Attachment object.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [OpenAttachmentFlags, AttachmentID] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopOpenAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.12).
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] OpenAttachmentFlags: 1 byte containing one of the following values [0x00, 0x01 and 0x03].
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] [OpenAttachmentFlags] [ReadOnly (0x00)] Attachment will be opened as read only.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] [OpenAttachmentFlags] [ReadWrite (0x01)] Attachment will be opened for both reading and writing.

[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] [OpenAttachmentFlags] [BestAccess (0x03)] Attachment will be opened for read/write if the user has write permissions for the attachment; opened for read-only if not.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] AttachmentID: 4 bytes containing the ID of the Attachment object to be opened, as specified by the PidTagAttachNumber property (section 2.2.2.6).
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopOpenAttachment ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.12.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2143, MS-OXCROPS_R2145, MS-OXCROPS_R2146, MS-OXCROPS_R2147, MS-OXCROPS_R2149.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenAttachment ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopOpenAttachment ROP response buffer.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP] The RopCreateAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13) creates a new Attachment object on the Message object.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP] For this ROP [RopCreateAttachment], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP] [For ROP RopCreateAttachment], the value of the OutputHandleIndex field references an Attachment object.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP Request Buffer] The syntax of the RopCreateAttachment ROP request buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP Request Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopCreateAttachment ROP request buffer.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopCreateAttachment ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2164, MS-OXCROPS_R2166, MS-OXCROPS_R2167, MS-OXCROPS_R2168, MS-OXCROPS_R2170, MS-OXCROPS_R2172, MS-OXCROPS_R2173, MS-OXCROPS_R2176, MS-OXCROPS_R2178, MS-OXCROPS_R2179, MS-OXCROPS_R2180, MS-OXCROPS_R2182, MS-OXCROPS_R2184.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopCreateAttachment ROP Response Buffer] The field specified in this section is part of the RopCreateAttachment ROP response buffer.
[In RopCreateAttachment ROP Response Buffer] AttachmentID: 4 bytes containing the ID for the Attachment object that was created.
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP] The RopDeleteAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.14) deletes an existing Attachment object from the Message object.
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP] For this ROP [RopDeleteAttachment], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [AttachmentID] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopDeleteAttachment ROP [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.14.
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP Request Buffer] AttachmentID: 4 bytes containing the ID of the Attachment object to be deleted.
[In RopDeleteAttachment ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopDeleteAttachment ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.14.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2198, MS-OXCROPS_R2200, MS-OXCROPS_R2201, MS-OXCROPS_R2202, MS-OXCROPS_R2204.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteAttachment ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopDeleteAttachment ROP response buffer.
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] The RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15) commits the changes made to the Attachment object.
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] For this ROP [RopSaveChangesAttachment], the value of the ResponseHandleIndex field references the containing Message object.
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] [For ROP RopSaveChangesAttachment], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references an Attachment object.

[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] If pending changes include changes to read-only properties [PidTagAccessLevel, PidTagObjectType, PidTagRecordKey, PidTagAttachSize], the server MAY<16> return an error.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1922.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [SaveFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15).
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP Request Buffer] SaveFlags: As specified in section 2.2.3.3.1.
[In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2222, MS-OXCROPS_R2224, MS-OXCROPS_R2225, MS-OXCROPS_R2226, MS-OXCROPS_R2228.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP response buffer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP] The RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16) retrieves a handle to a Message object from the given Attachment object.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP] For this ROP [RopOpenEmbeddedMessage], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references an Attachment object.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP] [For ROP RopOpenEmbeddedMessage], the value of the OutputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [CodePageId, OpenModeFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16).
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] CodePageId: 2 bytes specifying the code page in which the non-Unicode representation of the strings on this Message object MUST be encoded.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags: 1 byte.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] The following values [0x00, 0x01 and 0x02] are valid for this flag [OpenModeFlags].
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [ReadOnly (0x00)] Message will be opened as read only.<17>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R3013, MS-OXCMSG_R3014.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [ReadWrite (0x01)] Message will be opened for both reading and writing.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] [OpenModeFlags] [Create (0x02)] Create the attachment if it does not already exist and open the message for both reading and writing.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions [MessageId, HasNamedProperties, SubjectPrefix, NormalizedSubject, RecipientCount, ColumnCount, RecipientColumns, RowCount and RecipientRows] define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16).
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Response Buffer] MessageId: 8 bytes containing the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the Message object.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Response Buffer] HasNamedProperties, SubjectPrefix, NormalizedSubject, RecipientCount, ColumnCount, RecipientColumns, RowCount, and RecipientRows.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R672, MS-OXCMSG_R673, MS-OXCMSG_R1668, MS-OXCMSG_R676, MS-OXCMSG_R678, MS-OXCMSG_R679, MS-OXCMSG_R680, MS-OXCMSG_R681, MS-OXCMSG_R683, MS-OXCMSG_R684, MS-OXCMSG_R682, MS-OXCMSG_R686, MS-OXCMSG_R977, MS-OXCMSG_R978, MS-OXCMSG_R979, MS-OXCMSG_R1298, MS-OXCMSG_R984, MS-OXCMSG_R685.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Response Buffer] The presence of data in the RecipientRows field is indeterminate, even when the embedded message exists.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] The RopGetAttachmentTable ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.17) retrieves a handle to a Table object that represents the attachments stored on the Message object.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] For more details on Table objects, see [MS-OXCTABL].
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] For this ROP [RopGetAttachment], the value of the InputHandleIndex field references a Message object.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] [For ROP RopGetAttachment], the value of the OutputHandleIndex field references a Table object.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [TableFlags] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetAttachmentTable ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.17).
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] Table Flags: The size of Table Flags is 1-byte.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] The following values [0x00, 0x40] are valid for this flag [TableFlags].
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] [Standard (0x00)] Open the table.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] [Unicode (0x40)] Open the table.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request Buffer] [TableFlags] [Unicode (0x40)] Also requests that the columns containing string data be returned in Unicode format.
[In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetAttachmentTable ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.17.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2308, MS-OXCROPS_R2310, MS-OXCROPS_R2311, MS-OXCROPS_R2312, MS-OXCROPS_R2314.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopGetAttachmentTable ROP response buffer.

[In RopGetValidAttachments ROP] The RopGetValidAttachments ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.18) gets the attachment IDs for all attachments that have previously been saved and have been assigned a valid numeric identifier.<18>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1715.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetValidAttachments ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetValidAttachments ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetValidAttachments ROP Request Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetValidAttachments ROP request buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.18.1.
[In RopGetValidAttachments ROP Request Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopGetAttachmentTable ROP request buffer.
[In RopGetValidAttachments ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetValidAttachments ROP request buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.18.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R2324, MS-OXCROPS_R2327, MS-OXCROPS_R2328, MS-OXCROPS_R2329, MS-OXCROPS_R2331, MS-OXCROPS_R2333, MS-OXCROPS_R2334, MS-OXCROPS_R2335, MS-OXCROPS_R2336, MS-OXCROPS_R2337.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetValidAttachments ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCMSG] adds no additional field information to the RopGetValidAttachments ROP response buffer.
[In Abstract Data Model] This section describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol [MS-OXCMSG].
[In Abstract Data Model] The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This document [MS-OXCMSG] does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this document.
[In Abstract Data Model] The following abstract data model (ADM) data types [Global, Mailbox Message, Object] are defined in this section.
[In Per Global] This protocol includes the following ADM elements [Global.Handle] for the client.
[In Per Global] Global.Handle, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.1.1.
[In Per Global] Session context cookie, as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 3.1.1.<19>
[In Per Mailbox] Mailboxes are represented by the Mailbox ADM object type.
[In Per Mailbox] The following ADM objects [Mailbox.MessageObject] are maintained for each Mailbox.
[In Per Mailbox] Mailbox.MessageObject: An abstract representation of a Message object.
[In Per Message Object] A Message object is represented by the MessageObject ADM data type.
[In Per Message Object] The following ADM elements [MessageObject.ReadState] are maintained for each MessageObject.
[In Per Message Object] MessageObject.ReadState: A state specifying whether the message has been read by a user, as specified in section 3.1.4.10.
[In Per Message Object] The possible state values [Unsent, Read and Resend] are as follows.
[In Per Message Object] [MessageObject.ReadState] Unsent: The message has not been sent.
[In Per Message Object] [MessageObject.ReadState] Read: The message has been read.
[In Per Message Object] [MessageObject.ReadState] Resend: The message has been marked for resending.
[In Opening a Message Object] A client obtains a handle to an existing Message object by sending a RopOpenMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R321.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Creating a Message Object] A client creates a new Message object by sending a RopCreateMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R687.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Saving Changes on a Message Object] A client saves all the changes to a Message object by sending a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Removing All Recipients] A client clears all recipients (2) from a Message object by sending a RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.4).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R381, MS-OXCMSG_R382.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Adding] A client modifies recipients (2) of the Message object by sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R388.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Reading Recipients] A client retrieves a list of all recipients (2) on the Message object by sending a RopReadRecipients ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R400.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Reload Message Object Header Info] A client retrieves the current state of the data returned in a RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1) by sending a RopReloadCachedInformation ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.7).

[In Setting Message Status] A client changes the status on a header message object (that is, marks or unmarks it for download or delete) by sending a RopSetMessageStatus ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R416.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Getting Message Status] A client checks the status of a header message object by sending a RopGetMessageStatus ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R786.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Setting Message Object Read State] A client marks one or more Message objects as read or unread without opening the Message objects by sending a RopSetReadFlags ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1703.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Setting Message Object Read State] When a user marks or unmarks a single opened Message object as read, the client sends a RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.11).
[In Opening an Attachment] A client opens and manipulates an existing Attachment object to a Message object by sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.12).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R436.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Creating an Attachment] A client adds a new Attachment object to a Message object by sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R867.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Deleting an Attachment] A client deletes an attachment from a Message object by sending a RopDeleteAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.14).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R469.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Setting Attachment Object Content] A client adds the contents of a file to an Attachment object by sending a RopSetProperties ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6) as specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.5.
[In Saving Changes on an Attachment Object] A client saves changes to an Attachment object by sending a RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R446, MS-OXCMSG_R1523.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Opening an Embedded Message Object] A client opens an existing Attachment object and manipulates it as if it were a Message object by sending a RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R889.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Accessing the Attachments Table] A client retrieves information about all Attachment objects associated with a Message object without opening each Attachment object by sending a RopGetAttachmentTable ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.17).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R312.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Creating an Embedded Message] A client creates an embedded message by sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13) to create an attachment on a message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R867.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Saving an Embedded Message] A client saves an embedded message by sending a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) on the embedded message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Saving an Embedded Message] Then the client sends a RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15) on the attachment from which the embedded message was opened.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Saving an Embedded Message] Finally, the client sends a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP on the enclosing message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Linking a Contact Object] To link a Contact object with another Message object, the client sets the following properties [PidLidContactLinkEntry, PidLidContactLinkName, PidLidContactLinkSearchKey and PidLidContacts].
[In Linking a Contact Object] Additional details are specified in section 2.2.1.59.

[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] To send the RopOpenMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1), the client first obtains the MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) for the Message object to be opened, and either the FID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) or the LogonID.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R693, MS-OXCMSG_R848, MS-OXCMSG_R849.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The MID is accessible from the contents table of the Folder object that contains the Message object by including the PidTagMid property ([MS-OXCFXICS] section 2.2.1.2.1) in a RopSetColumns ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.5.1), as specified in [MS-OXCTABL] section 2.2.2.2.
[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] To open a soft deleted Message object, the client MUST include the OpenSoftDeleted flag in the OpenModeFlag field.

[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] When the client receives the response buffer, it [client] can cache the data from the NormalizedSubject and SubjectPrefix fields to minimize further calls to the server.

[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] It [client] then updates the cache when issuing a RopSetProperties ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6) for the PidTagNormalizedSubject property (section 2.2.1.10) and the PidTagSubjectPrefix property (section 2.2.1.9) and uses the cached values.
[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The client uses the opened Message object in subsequent ROPs.
[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] It [client] MUST eventually send a RopRelease ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.15.3) on the Message object.
[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] After doing so [send a RopRelease ROP request], [client] MUST NOT use the Message object for any subsequent ROPs.

[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The client is responsible for maintaining the privacy of the properties on the Message object when the PidLidPrivate property (section 2.2.1.15) is set to 0x01.
[In Sending a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] If a client does not recognize a message class, it reverts to acting on all but the last group, recursively, until a recognized form remains.

[In Sending a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP Request] The client controls the access level of the Message object after saving changes by calling the RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) by setting the proper flags as specified in section 2.2.3.3.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopCreateMessage ROP Request] After calling the RopCreateMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2), the client sends a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) to commit the new Message object and uses the opened Message object in subsequent ROPs.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R339.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopCreateMessage ROP Request] It [client] MUST eventually send a RopRelease ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.15.3) on the Message object.
[In Sending a RopCreateMessage ROP Request] After doing so [send a RopRelease ROP request], [client] MUST NOT use the Message object for any subsequent ROPs.

[In Sending a RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP Request] After calling the RopRemoveAllRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.4), the client commits the changes by sending a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) for the Message object associated with the removed recipients (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R381, MS-OXCMSG_R382.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] To modify an existing recipient (2) using the RopModifyRecipients ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.5), the client sets the RowId field of the RecipientRows field to the row ID of the recipient (2) to be modified and sets all of the ModifyRecipientRow data to the desired values for that recipient (2), including any additional property information for the recipients (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R388, MS-OXCMSG_R389.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] Additional property information is set by adding values for the PropertyTag field to the RecipientColumns field and including the property values in the RecipientRows field.

[In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] To delete an existing recipient (2), the client sets the RowId field to the row ID of the recipient (2) to be deleted and sets the RecipientRowSize field to 0x0000.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R391.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] To add a new recipient (2), the client sets the RowId field to a value greater than the largest row ID for any recipient (2) that already exists on the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R389.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] The client sets all of the data in the ModifyRecipientRow field to the desired values for that recipient (2), including any additional property information.

[In Sending a RopModifyRecipients ROP Request] To commit the changes, the client sends a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) for the Message object associated with the added recipients (2).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R718, MS-OXCMSG_R719, MS-OXCMSG_R722, MS-OXCMSG_R723, MS-OXCMSG_R724.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopReadRecipients ROP Request] If the count of recipients and the count of recipient rows in the RopOpenMessage ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1) are the same, then the client can use the information in the RecipientRow field from the RopOpenMessage ROP instead of sending a RopReadRecipients ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.6).

[In Sending a RopReadRecipients ROP Request] If the counts are not equal, the client MUST issue a series of RopReadRecipients ROP requests to retrieve all the recipients associated with the Message object.

[In Sending a RopReadRecipients ROP Request] A client accesses the information for all recipients in the message by setting the RowId field to 0x00000000, and then iteratively sending RopReadRecipients ROP requests with an increasing row ID value to obtain the recipients that did not fit in the previous request.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1495.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request] The client uses the RopSetMessageStatus ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8) to set the value of the PidTagMessageStatus property (section 2.2.1.8).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R416.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request] Additionally, the PidTagMessageStatus property can be set as a column on a contents table, as specified in [MS-OXCTABL] section 2.2.2.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCTABL_R426.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request] To modify the status of a header message object, clients: 1. Obtain the message's MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2), as specified in section 3.1.5.1.

[In Sending a RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request] [To modify the status of a header message object, clients:] 2. Send the RopSetMessageStatus ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8), setting the mask and status appropriately.

[In Sending a RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request] The client uses the RopGetMessageStatus ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9) to obtain the value of the PidTagMessageStatus property (section 2.2.1.8).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R793.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request] To retrieve the status of a header message object, clients: 1. Obtain the message's MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2), as specified in section 3.1.5.1.
[In Sending a RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request] [To retrieve the status of a header message object, clients:] 2. Send the RopGetMessageStatus ROP request.

[In Sending a RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request] [To retrieve the status of a header message object, clients: 2. Send the RopGetMessageStatus ROP request;] if the request succeeds, the value of the header message object's PidTagMessageStatus property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.799) is returned in the response buffer.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R793.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetReadFlags ROP Request] The client obtains a list of MIDs ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) using a contents table , as specified in section 3.1.4.1, and uses the list of MIDs in the RopSetReadFlags ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.10).

[In Sending a RopSetReadFlags ROP Request] The client controls whether the Message object is marked as read or unread, as well as the sending of read receipts, by setting the appropriate flags as specified in section 2.2.3.10.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R815, MS-OXCMSG_R817, MS-OXCMSG_R818, MS-OXCMSG_R822, MS-OXCMSG_R825, MS-OXCMSG_R827, MS-OXCMSG_R829.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP Request] When sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.12) to open an attachment, the client MUST use a valid value for the AttachmentID field.
[In Sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP Request] For more information about opening an Embedded Message object, see section 3.1.4.17.
[In Sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP Request] The client uses the opened Attachment object in subsequent ROPs.
[In Sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP Request] It [client] eventually sends a RopRelease ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.15.3) on the Attachment object.
[In Sending a RopOpenAttachment ROP Request] After doing so [client sends a RopRelease ROP request], [client] MUST NOT use the Attachment object for any subsequent ROPs.

[In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] After creating a new attachment with a call to the RopCreateAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.13), the client sends a RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15) to commit the new Attachment object and uses the newly created Attachment object in subsequent ROPs.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R446.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] The client eventually sends a RopRelease ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.15.3) on the Attachment object.
[In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] After doing so [client sends a RopRelease ROP request], [client] MUST NOT use the Attachment object for any subsequent ROPs.

[In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] To create an Embedded Message object, the client uses the RopSetProperties ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6) to set the afEmbeddedMessage flag on the PidTagAttachMethod property (section 2.2.2.9).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R596.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] Finally the client sends a RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16) on the attachment to get a Message object handle.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R889.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopCreateAttachment ROP Request] The client sends a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) to commit the Attachment object change to the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R446.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetProperties ROP Request] Depending on the type of Attachment object being created by sending the RopSetProperties ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6), the client sets the appropriate value for the PidTagAttachMethod property, as specified in section 2.2.2.9.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R588, MS-OXCMSG_R590, MS-OXCMSG_R592, MS-OXCMSG_R594, MS-OXCMSG_R596.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetProperties ROP Request] The client sends a RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15) to commit the change to the Attachment object and a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request to commit the Attachment object change to the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R446, MS-OXCMSG_R1523, MS-OXCMSG_R728.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSetProperties ROP Request] To set the PidTagMessageStatus property (section 2.2.1.8), the client does not include it in a RopSetProperties ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.6), as specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.5.
[In Sending a RopSetProperties ROP Request] Instead, the client calls the RopSetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.8), as specified in section 2.2.3.8.

[In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] To get the PidTagMessageStatus property (section 2.2.1.8), the client does not include it in a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.3).
[In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] Instead, the client calls the RopGetMessageStatus ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.9), as specified in section 2.2.3.9.

[In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] The client does not include the PidTagSubjectPrefix property (section 2.2.1.9) in a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.3).
[In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] Instead, the client uses the SubjectPrefix field from the RopOpenMessage ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R676.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] The client does not include the PidTagNormalizedSubject property (section 2.2.1.10) in a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.3).
[In Sending a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP Request] Instead, the client uses the NormalizedSubject field from the RopOpenMessage ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R678.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP Request] After saving changes to an attachment with a call to the RopSaveChangesAttachment ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.15), the client sends a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3) to commit the Attachment object changes to the Message object.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1062.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Sending a RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request] The client uses the Message object opened by the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.16) in subsequent ROPs.
[In Sending a RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request] It [client] eventually sends a RopRelease ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.15.3) on the Message object.
[In Sending a RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request] After doing so [sends a RopRelease ROP request], [client] MUST NOT use the Message object for any subsequent ROPs.

[In Sending a RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request] When a client calls the RopGetAttachmentTable ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.17), the server returns a table of properties for each Attachment object associated with the Message object, as specified in [MS-OXCTABL].

[In Sending a RopGetAttachmentTable ROP Request] To retrieve the attachment ID, the client includes the PidTagAttachNumber property (section 2.2.2.6) when sending a RopSetColumns ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.5.1).
[In Abstract Data Model] This section describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[In Abstract Data Model] The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This document [MS-OXCMSG] does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this document.
[In Abstract Data Model] The following ADM data types [Global, Mailbox and MessageObject] are defined in this section.
[In Per Global] This protocol includes the following ADM elements [Global.Handle] for the server.
[In Per Global] Global.Handle, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.1.1.
[In Per Global] Session context cookie, as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 3.2.1.<20>
[In Per Mailbox] Mailboxes are represented by the Mailbox ADM data type.
[In Per Mailbox] The following ADM elements [Mailbox.MessageObject] are maintained for each Mailbox.
[In Per Mailbox] Mailbox.MessageObject: An abstract representation of a Message object.
[In Per Message Object] A Message object is represented by the MessageObject ADM data type.
[In Per Message Object] The following ADM elements [MessageObject.AttachmentTable, MessageObject.Transactions] are maintained for each MessageObject.
[In Per Message Object] MessageObject.AttachmentTable: The set of attachments associated with a message.
[In Per Message Object] MessageObject.Transactions: A record of the open Global.Handle ADM elements (section 3.2.1.1) against a MessageObject.
[In Per Message Object] [MessageObject.Transactions] Each Global.Handle ADM element is given its own transaction (3).

[In Per Message Object] [MessageObject.Transactions] If a change to a MessageObject is committed on one Global.Handle ADM element, the server prevents changes from being saved against other open Global.Handle ADM elements on the same MessageObject, as specified in section 3.2.5.3.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R704, MS-OXCMSG_R705.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Requesting Body Properties] When a client requests the Message body, it [client] can either use the best body algorithm as specified in [MS-OXBBODY] or directly request one of the body properties specified in section 2.2.1.58.
[In Requesting Body Properties] In the second case, the server SHOULD convert whatever body property it has for the message into the requested format.

[In Requesting Body Properties] For example, if the message contains the body in the PidTagBodyHtml property (section 2.2.1.58.3) and the client requests the PidTagBody property (section 2.2.1.58.1), the server converts the PidTagBodyHtml property to a plain text representation and returns this converted value.
[In Requesting Body Properties] The semantics for converting from one body format to another are implementation-dependent.

[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The Message object returned by the RopOpenMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1) is used in subsequent ROPs, such as a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.8.3).
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] For information about which ROPs operate on Message objects, see the specific ROPs in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] When the server receives multiple requests to open the same Message object, it returns a different handle and maintains a separate transaction (3) for each.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] A RopOpenMessage ROP MUST NOT succeed if a Message object with the specified ID does not exist.
[in Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] RopOpenMessage MUST NOT succeed if the client has insufficient access rights to the folder in which the Message object is stored.

[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] If the OpenModeFlag field includes the OpenSoftDeleted flag, the RopOpenMessage ROP provides access to all Message objects, including soft deleted Message objects.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] If the OpenSoftDeleted flag is not included, the server MUST NOT provide access to soft deleted Message objects.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The response field RecipientCount indicates the current number of recipients (2) in the message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R679.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] In addition, the server returns data for as many recipients (2) as will fit in the response buffer, in the order of the value of the RowId field.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The data for each recipient (2) is encoded as an OpenRecipientRow structure in the RecipientRows field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R685.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The response field RowCount indicates how many recipients (2) are present in the RecipientRows field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R683.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] If a server does not recognize a message class, it reverts to acting on all but the last group, recursively, until a recognized form remains.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] The following specific error codes [ecNotFound],[ecAccessDenied] apply to this ROP [RopOpenMessage].
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] [ecNotFound (0x8004010F)] The MID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) does not correspond to a message in the database.

[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] [ecNotFound (0x8004010F)] The folder corresponding to the FID ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) entered in the ROP request buffer does not contain a message with the entered MID.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] ecNullObject (0x000004b9)] The value of the InputHandleIndex field on which this ROP was called does not refer to a Folder object or a Store object
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] [ecNotFound (0x8004010F)] The message is soft deleted and the client has not specified the OpenSoftDeleted flag as part of the OpenModeFlag field.
[In Receiving a RopOpenMessage ROP Request] [ecAccessDenied(0x80070005)] The user does not have rights to the message.

[In Receiving a RopCreateMessage ROP Request] When processing the RopCreateMessage ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2), the server MUST NOT commit the new Message object until it [server] receives a RopSaveChangesMessage ROP request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.3).
